entries.name: new(string=""[, mode])click to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates new StringIO instance from with string and mode.

entries.name: open(string=""[, mode]) {|strio| ...}click to toggle source
entries.desc: Equivalent to ::new except that when it is called with a block, it yields with the new instance and closes it, and returns the result which returned from the block.

entries.name: binmode    → stringioclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Puts stream into binary mode. See IO#binmode.

entries.name: bytes()
entries.desc: This is a deprecated alias for each_byte.

entries.name: chars()
entries.desc: This is a deprecated alias for each_char.

entries.name: close  → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes a StringIO. The stream is unavailable for any further data operations; an IOError is raised if such an attempt is made.

entries.name: close_read    → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes the read end of a StringIO.  Will raise an IOError if the receiver is not readable.

entries.name: close_write    → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes the write end of a StringIO.  Will raise an  IOError if the receiver is not writeable.

entries.name: closed?    → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is completely closed, false otherwise.

entries.name: closed_read?    → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is not readable, false otherwise.

entries.name: closed_write?    → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is not writable, false otherwise.

entries.name: codepoints()
entries.desc: This is a deprecated alias for each_codepoint.

entries.name: each(sep=$/, chomp: false) {|line| block }         → strioclick to toggle source
each_byte {|byte| block }  → strioclick to toggle source
each_char {|char| block }  → strioclick to toggle source
each_codepoint {|c| block }  → strioclick to toggle source
each_line(sep=$/, chomp: false) {|line| block }     → strioclick to toggle source
eof     → true or falseclick to toggle source
eof?    → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is at the end of the data (underlying string). The stream must be opened for reading or an IOError will be raised.

entries.name: external_encoding   => encodingclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the Encoding object that represents the encoding of the file. If the stream is write mode and no encoding is specified, returns nil.

entries.name: fcntl(*args)
entries.desc: Raises NotImplementedError.

entries.name: fileno()
entries.desc: Returns nil.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: flush()
entries.desc: Returns an object itself.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: fsync()
entries.desc: Returns 0.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: getbyte   → fixnum or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: See IO#getbyte.

entries.name: getc   → string or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: See IO#getc.

entries.name: gets(sep=$/, chomp: false)     → string or nilclick to toggle source
internal_encoding   => encodingclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the Encoding of the internal string if conversion is specified.  Otherwise returns nil.

entries.name: isatty()
entries.desc: Returns false.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: length → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the size of the buffer string.

entries.name: lineno    → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the current line number. The stream must be opened for reading. lineno counts the number of times  gets is called, rather than the number of newlines  encountered. The two values will differ if gets is  called with a separator other than newline.  See also the  $. variable.

entries.name: lineno = integer    → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Manually sets the current line number to the given value. $. is updated only on the next read.

entries.name: lines(*args)
entries.desc: This is a deprecated alias for each_line.

entries.name: pid()
entries.desc: Returns nil.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: pos = integer    → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Seeks to the given position (in bytes).

entries.name: putc(obj)    → objclick to toggle source
entries.desc: See IO#putc.

entries.name: read([length [, outbuf]])    → string, outbuf, or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: See IO#read.

entries.name: readlines(sep=$/, chomp: false)     →   arrayclick to toggle source
rewind    → 0click to toggle source
entries.desc: Positions the stream to the beginning of input, resetting lineno to zero.

entries.name: seek(amount, whence=SEEK_SET) → 0click to toggle source
entries.desc: Seeks to a given offset amount in the stream according to the value of whence (see IO#seek).

entries.name: set_encoding(ext_enc, [int_enc[, opt]])  => strioclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specify the encoding of the StringIO as ext_enc. Use the default external encoding if ext_enc is nil. 2nd argument int_enc and optional hash opt argument are ignored; they are for API compatibility to IO.

entries.name: size   → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the size of the buffer string.

entries.name: string     → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns underlying String object, the subject of IO.

entries.name: string = string  → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Changes underlying String object, the subject of IO.

entries.name: sync    → trueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true always.

entries.name: sync=(p1)
entries.desc: Returns the argument unchanged.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: truncate(integer)    → 0click to toggle source
entries.desc: Truncates the buffer string to at most integer bytes. The stream must be opened for writing.

entries.name: tty?()
entries.desc: Returns false.  Just for compatibility to IO.

entries.name: ungetbyte(fixnum)   → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: See IO#ungetbyte

entries.name: ungetc(string)   → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Pushes back one character (passed as a parameter) such that a subsequent buffered read will return it.  There is no limitation for multiple pushbacks including pushing back behind the beginning of the buffer string.
